metadata.name: Drei #26
metadata.description:
For Lia Drei (https://www.archivioguerrieridrei.com/biografia-1?lang=en)

This morning I thought about all the work I did with triangles... the idea came to me that the right triangle is the symbol of creation...(…)
The hypotenuse is the love that unites and gives life. The tip of the triangle is the uterus which makes the space grow.
-- LIA DREI (Diaries, 2004)

My paintings have no past, they are empty of meaning in the present, but await the discussions of the future, as remotely as possible.
And this is why they don't have their feet firmly planted in the ground, although there are invisible roots that take life from the earth, like so many blades of grass.
While I work I look for the truth in what I do. The time is not yesterday because it would be false, it is not today because the emotion takes my breath away and I die every moment and am reborn after every new brushstroke.
Soon after, time becomes old, useless, meaningless. I never know what will come out with the next brushstroke or spatula stroke.
My thoughts go at supersonic speed and only stop to choose another color. The one just painted is never the right one. So I live the life of the new painting with the sense of mystery that the moonless night has. (…)
-- LIA DREI (Notes, 1962)

----

I never talk about myself.

I'm not creative.
I blatantly steal other people's art.
I'm a bad coder, I copy, paste, mix ideas.
I often ruin it, degrade it.
But I always make it mine what I like.

I absorb.

-- ALESSANDRO FIORE (fxhash, 2024)


—————

The work is created responsive by default and it will adapt to the browser window. It will change (even consistently in some cases) based on the screen aspect ratio.

Key commands:

1 = Square 2000x2000
2 = Square 4000x4000
3 = Square 6000x6000 (Dependent on your browser limitations, tested on Safari (Mac))
p = Portrait 1500x2115
l = Landscape 2115x1500
e = Responsive/Default
f = Fullscreen
s = Save as image


See LICENSE.txt in live view for licensing details.

metadata.name: Reflejos #19
metadata.description:
Reflejos es un proyecto de arte generativo diseñado para existir en la blockchain de Tezos. Este proyecto se aloja en la plataforma fx(hash) y genera obras de arte únicas utilizando un algoritmo y un sistema numérico hexadecimal que se crea con cada nuevo token.

Este proyecto fue desarrollado utilizando la librería p5.js de JavaScript, creada por Lauren Lee McCarthy. Reflejos es el resultado de la interacción entre la percepción humana y un conjunto de reglas interpretadas por la máquina.

Inspirado por la experiencia de caminar junto al mar y los estados de calma y contemplación que esta actividad puede evocar, Reflejos busca entrelazar a los espectadores con las obras de la colección. 

La intención es motivar al espectador a explorar su interior y descubrir momentos de apertura perceptiva. 

El objetivo es que la obra provoque una sensación de calma y claridad en el espectador a través de una conexión íntima y personal.

metadata.name: Smoke #57
metadata.description:
Inspired by the hot weather of the city.
Made in August 2022, Milano, Italy.

5 visible Features:
-Mood: tender, bleed, icecream, summer in Milano, evening, futurepunk, acid, love
-Size: small, regular, big
-Density: low, moderate, high, very high
-Speed: slow, moderate, fast
-Emissions: from 2 to 9

Some of the features are very rare, others less, some more common.

The design is being optimized to render at different speeds depending on the size of the window. The smaller the size, the faster the render and lower the detail, viceversa bigger the size, slower the render and higher the detail.
The moire effect of lines that are making the shades of the artwork will look thick with a low resolution, and become finer and more detailed the higher the resolution. You can use this feature to create quick previews or to save very Hi-Resolution images.
To save an image with the size of the window press S once the image is fully rendered.
The fx(hash) thumbnail is saved at 1425px x 1900px.
To save a Hi-Resolution image 3000px x 4000px press H and wait, the page will reload and start to render. Please be patient.

Built using p5js, published under CC-BY-NC-4.0 license.

Once the collection will be fully minted, the variations button will be disabled.

metadata.name: Pinwheel #130
metadata.description:
A pinwheel.

Created as part of the anniversary mint event #fxhashturnsone.

In fullscreen mode: double click, double tap or press 's' to save a still at the current resolution.

metadata.name: Frozen Roses #17
metadata.description:
Each Frozen Rose is a unique, looping, generative animation.

Frozen Roses uses an underlying pattern of voronoi cells generated from a rotating pattern of points. The differences in these initial patterns of points result in a wide variety of unique shapes and structures. The voronoi pattern is then fed into a series of shaders designed with a user-guided evolutionary process to produce the final animations.

metadata.name: Precision: angles #247
metadata.description:
This is the first hash-derived entry into my "Precisions" series.  I have been using Precisions as a meditative art practice where I focus on exact positioning of elements, less-emphasized colors, and repetition of geometric shapes.  

In "angles", each element is comprised of right triangles transformed over a common point.  I decided to bring some of the fragmentation from my previous project, "Restrictions", to produce irregular works.  I found beauty in that unpredictable asymmetry and feel it really enhances the structure of this piece.

metadata.name: Ode to GM #201
metadata.description: An ode to Good Morning (gm), with a callback to the patterns used in my Ode to Roy generative project.

metadata.name: Ode to GM #336
metadata.description: An ode to Good Morning (gm), with a callback to the patterns used in my Ode to Roy generative project.

metadata.name: Agave & Patchwork #42
metadata.description:
Agave & Patchwork
---------------
Controls:
Press 1-6 to change the scale of the canvas (1 = default, 2000px x 2000px, 6 = 12,000px x 12,000px)
S: Save output at current size
F: Toggle fullscreen
Add the url params x and y to set custom dimensions. For example, add &x=1500&y=500 for a 1500px x 500px image
---------------
Tyler Boswell (@teaboswell) 2023
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0, See bundle.js.LICENSE.txt for third party license information

metadata.name: VIBE #81
Klyft #989
metadata.description:
“Klyft” is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel.

Klyft is a juxtaposition of two different projections for the future. One, made by the World Economic Forum, suggests that the global gender gap will have closed by the year 2154. The other, by the UN IPCC, estimates that global warming will reach 3.2 degrees celcius by the year 2100.

Klyft makes use of the unique temporal aspect of computational art by developing its expression gradually over the next 132 years. As we come closer to 2154, the space between the two shapes in Klyft will grow smaller to symbolize the closing of the gender gap. As time goes on, however, Klyft also becomes more and more glitched out to represent the projected increases in greenhouse gases and climate catastrophes.

In the end, Klyft’s expression will be heavily corrupted, and the two shapes will have reached each other.

· URL parameters ·

You can add the following parameters to the URL to change the behavior of the piece.

date=<YYYY-MM-DD> — See how Klyft looks on another day. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD. 

color=<number> — See the piece in another color scheme. The numbers loop around, so 17 equals 0, 18 equals 1, etc. 

resolution=<number> — View the piece in a higher resolution. 1 is normal resolution, 2 is double, etc. No decimals allowed.

image=true — Save the piece as an image. 

record=true — Save the piece as a video in WEBM format.

Adding the following URL parameters will show Klyft in double resolution on the day gender equality is achieved according to the WEF:

date=2154-01-01&resolution=2

Adding the following URL parameters will save a video of Klyft in the ‘Stokkendahl Dalgas’ color scheme:

color=14&record=true

· Interactions ·

Pressing the following keys will trigger functionality as well as add related URL parameters automatically. 

Pressing D will increment the date by 1 year.

Pressing C will increment the color index by 1.

Pressing R will toggle between normal and double resolution.

Pressing I will toggle the image URL parameter, which saves the piece as an image. Only works outside of iframe.

Pressing V will toggle the video URL parameter, which saves the piece as a video. Only works outside of iframe.

There are secret key presses as well. Some of them only work outside of iframe. 

· Accessibility ·

Klyft is built to support screen readers. It has been tested using MacOS’ VoiceOver, and uses p5.js’ describeElement() to provide screen reader functionality.

If you have any comments (good or bad) on the screen reader integration, don’t hesitate to reach out on my Twitter: @ada_ada_ada_art. 

· Credits and license ·

Klyft is made with p5.js.

Klyft is licensed under a modified version of the Climate Strike License (CSL).

metadata.name: Yashinoki #70
metadata.description:
Inspired by classic Japanese woodblock prints and cross-sections of palm tree (yashinoki) trunks. 

Controls in live mode:
- Press [s] to save a png


Made with code by AutoEclectus.
 AutoEclectus is an artist specialising in code-based generative works.

@autoeclectus everywhere:
- Links: https://autoeclectus.art
- Twitter: autoeclectus
- Instagram: autoeclectus

© AutoEclectus - NFT License Version 2.0 - September 2022

metadata.name: CA Panico #243
metadata.description:
Third chapter of the trilogy dedicated to Stephen Wolfram's cellular automata.
 
Compared to CA Vista and CA Monti, CA Panico aims to further abstract the concept of landscape using CA rules in a more massive way.

The great variety of CA rules that controls the coloring and textures, noise influence, division into quadrants, chance of having glitches and outages all combined with 25 palettes and 5 different formats means that the outputs will be very varied and peculiar.

Press 'S' to download, you can zoom downloaded output to enjoy all the details.

metadata.name: ZigZag #381
metadata.description:
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃ ZigZag ⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Wikipedia
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

A zigzag is a pattern made up of small corners at variable angles, though constant within the zigzag, tracing a path between two parallel lines; it can be described as both jagged and fairly regular.
In geometry, this pattern is described as a skew apeirogon. From the point of view of symmetry, a regular zigzag can be generated from a simple motif like a line segment by repeated application of a glide reflection.

Another name for the pattern is "Herringbone" FYI 🤓

There's a chance no lines are shown at all, this is intentional, as I love "bugs" 🪲

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Keys
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

[b] toggle border
[n] toggle noise
[h] generate high res version
[s] save image

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Education - back to 1994
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

Zig and Zag are also 2 puppets, have a look here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zig_and_Zag_(puppets)
There's this amazing song if you don't know called "Zig & Zag - Them Girls Them Girls".
You can view it on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7bv_36P_f-w

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Special thanks
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

Liam Egan, for helping me with noise through a shader

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Royalties on secondary
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

40% Liam Egan
40% Obi
20% WTBS

metadata.name: Shape of Freedom #218
metadata.description:
A paper is a shape of freedom.

All proceeds go to FABDAO in supporting Human Rights activities.

Press 's' to save jpeg, Left/Right arrows to move steps forward and backward.

This project is using p5js and glfx.
